intro: Uncinia viridis, commonly known as the green hook-cup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are finely divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Uncinia viridis thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in tundra and alpine environments. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
